sources.title: David and Goliath
sources.description: The story of the film is adapted from the Old Testament: The Philistines declare war on the Israelites and wrench the Arch of the Allience from them. Saul (Orson Welles), the king of Israel, listens meanwhile to the words of the prophets who tell him that the new king will be a young shepard called David. But still David has to fight the enemy in form of their mighty giant Goliath. English dubbed. http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0054788/

sources.title: David and Goliath (1960)
sources.description: This ia a film adaptation of the Biblical story of the Israelite shepherd David, who became a hero and later king by his defeat of Goliath, the champion of the Philistines. It also deals with David's relation with the first king of Israel, Saul.

sources.title: David and Goliath (1960)
sources.description: When the Philistines attack, the Israelites are hopeless against the fierce giant Goliath and don't know what to do. King Saul takes the advice of the prophets and sends an adolescent shepherd, David, into battle to conquer the oversized Philistine. David is victorious and becomes the King of Israel. Watch on RetroFlix:Â  https://retroflix.org/david-and-goliath-1960/

sources.title: David and Goliath (1960) ORSON WELLES
sources.description:
Stars: Orson Welles, Ivica Pajer, Aldo Pedinotti
Directors: Ferdinando Baldi, Richard Pottier

WIDESCREEN EDITION! King Saul of the Israelites is visited by the Prophet Samuel who foretells him that a war with The Philistines is inevitable and the shepherd David will become king.

metadata.Plot: The story of the film is adapted from the Old Testament: The Philistines declare war on the Israelites and wrench the Arch of the Alliance from them. Saul, the king of Israel, listens meanwhile to the words of the prophets who tell him that the new king will be a young shepherd called David. But still David has to fight the enemy in form of their mighty giant, Goliath.
metadata.Director: Ferdinando Baldi, Richard Pottier, Orson Welles
metadata.Writer: Umberto Scarpelli, Gino Mangini, Ambrogio Molteni
metadata.Actors: Orson Welles, Ivica Pajer, Eleonora Rossi Drago
